snippet: After New York City proposed closing or merging several colleges in the CUNY system in 1975, Dr. Lynch supported student protests and found savings in the budget.
abstract: Gerald W Lynch, long-serving president of John Jay College of Criminal Justice who saved it from closing or merger during New York City's 1975 fiscal crisis, dies at age 76.
lead_paragraph: After New York City proposed closing or merging several colleges in the CUNY system in 1975, Dr. Lynch supported student protests and found savings in the budget.

headline.seo: Gerald W. Lynch, John Jay College Administrator, Dies at 76
headline.main: Gerald W. Lynch, Who Fought to Save John Jay College, Dies at 76
headline.print_headline:
Gerald Lynch, 76, President
Who Saved John Jay College
